task.summary: Default task

Added mapDispatchToProps as second optional parameter into connect function when exporting CoursesPage.js.
Defined mapDispatchToProps to get a dispatch and return a object which contains the result of calling the dispatch with the action to create the course.
Modified onclicksave deleting dispatch(courseActions because of we are using the dispatcher into the map itself.
Removed the proptype to rquire for dispatcher because connect doesn't need it.
Using bindActionCreators to wrap automatically the actions to let a dispatcher handle them. Updated propTypes Changed into mapDispatchToProps data name to actions Referenced actions into onclicksave.
Created a constants file called actionTypes Using it in courseActions and courseReducer
Added mockAuthorApi mockCourseApi and a delay from cory house repository to simulate making asynchronous calls with react redux.
Removing inline form from CoursesPage to separate creating and editing them in separate components.
Adding react thunk to the list of middlewares which uses the store to handle asynchronous calls
Created a function to get all courses from courses mock api and done error handling. Created a new actionType called LOAD_COURSES_SUCCESS and used it in courseActions
Changed from create course to LOAD_COURSES_SUCCESS in courseReducer to return the list.
Updated app entry point index.js to dispatch the loadCourses action into the store.

Extracted out JSX from CoursesPage to create a CourseList to add in it. Also created CourseListRow to manage each of them separately. Added in CoursesPage the reference to them and destructed the object we pass in.
Adding course category
Created a file template to make React container components directly. New ManageCoursePage to see their info. Added a route to the course management page and other to edit it.
Created a CourseForm which references two child components TextInput and SelectInput to host course data.
Created TextInput and SelectInput to host our JSX and logic to edit courses.
Updated ManageCoursePage to display edit course form ;=)
Created a thunk to relate actions and dispatch in an asynchronous call in authorActions

Created an authorReducer to get the state and fire the action poperly. Created an initialState to host in a constants file all initial states. Changed rootReducer aka reducers/index.js to execute our author one. Making in our entry index.js point a call from the store to get all authors.
Trying to map author data for the dropdown but browser says there is a bad import.
Added missing extension.js to authorActions!

MESSAGE.value:
Added mapDispatchToProps as second optional parameter into connect function when exporting CoursesPage.js.
Defined mapDispatchToProps to get a dispatch and return a object which contains the result of calling the dispatch with the action to create the course.
Modified onclicksave deleting dispatch(courseActions because of we are using the dispatcher into the map itself.
Removed the proptype to rquire for dispatcher because connect doesn't need it.
Using bindActionCreators to wrap automatically the actions to let a dispatcher handle them. Updated propTypes Changed into mapDispatchToProps data name to actions Referenced actions into onclicksave.
Created a constants file called actionTypes Using it in courseActions and courseReducer
Added mockAuthorApi mockCourseApi and a delay from cory house repository to simulate making asynchronous calls with react redux.
Removing inline form from CoursesPage to separate creating and editing them in separate components.
Adding react thunk to the list of middlewares which uses the store to handle asynchronous calls
Created a function to get all courses from courses mock api and done error handling. Created a new actionType called LOAD_COURSES_SUCCESS and used it in courseActions
Changed from create course to LOAD_COURSES_SUCCESS in courseReducer to return the list.
Updated app entry point index.js to dispatch the loadCourses action into the store.

Extracted out JSX from CoursesPage to create a CourseList to add in it. Also created CourseListRow to manage each of them separately. Added in CoursesPage the reference to them and destructed the object we pass in.
Created a file template to make React container components directly. New ManageCoursePage to see their info. Added a route to the course management page and other to edit it.
Created a CourseForm which references two child components TextInput and SelectInput to host course data.
Created TextInput and SelectInput to host our JSX and logic to edit courses.
Updated ManageCoursePage to display edit course form ;=)
Created a thunk to relate actions and dispatch in an asynchronous call in authorActions

Created an authorReducer to get the state and fire the action poperly. Created an initialState to host in a constants file all initial states. Changed rootReducer aka reducers/index.js to execute our author one. Making in our entry index.js point a call from the store to get all authors.
Trying to map author data for the dropdown but browser says there is a bad import.
